results.title: State fair
results.creator_credit: William Perlberg, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and Walter Lang
results.brief_description: Phil Stone’s best-selling novel about a country fair was originally filmed in 1933. This technicolour remake features a bright Rodgers and Hammerstein score and the wholesome pairing of Jeanne Crain and Dana Andrews as a couple who fall in love at the fair. The songs include “That’s for me” and “It might as well be spring”. The film also stars Fay Bainter and Dick Haymes. Academy Award winner for Best Musical Score in 1945.
results.creator_credit_for_label: William Perlberg, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and Walter Lang

results.title: State and Main
results.creator_credit: Sarah Green, Fine Line Features, Filmtown Entertainment, Green/Renzi, El Dorado Pictures and David Mamet
results.brief_description: Written and directed by David Mamet (The Winslow boy, The Spanish prisoner) “State and Main” is a humorous tale about the making of a big-budget Hollywood film in small town USA. Walt Price is a director in pre-production for his latest flick, “The Old mill” and plagued by problems. Having fled New Hampshire under a cloud, Price and his production team arrive in Waterford, Vermont, assuming that local inhabitants will be a pushover. Among Price’s hurdles are: leading man Bob Barrenger, whose hobby is picking up underage girls; leading actress Claire who has decided not to reveal her breasts for this particular film; writer Joseph Turner White who’s script has to be altered as the old mill has burnt down, making his title (and much of his script) redundant. Some locals take to the interlopers, but others seek to manipulate them to make a buck. Town folk include Ann, an amateur writer who assists White with his screenplay; Carla, a teenager with designs on Barrenger; and George Bailey, the mayor intent on making his town famous. “State and Main” is layered with numerous stories about the creation of a Hollywood film. Starring Phillip Seymour Hoffman, Rebecca Pidgeon, William H. Macy, Sarah Jessica Parker and Julia Stiles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sarah Green, Fine Line Features, Filmtown Entertainment, Green/Renzi, El Dorado Pictures and David Mamet

results.title: State aid for the needy
results.brief_description: Social aid to the people of Fribourg is adminstered under the Federal Social Aid Law. This provides financial assistance to those whose income is below the specified basic income. Assists in vocational education of normal and physically handicapped children, provides accommodation and entertainment for the aged, nurseries for the children of working mothers, as well as financial and domestic aid to young mothers.

results.title: Startup.com
results.creator_credit: D.A. Pennebaker, Pennebaker Hegedus Films, Chris Hegedus, Noujaim Films and Jehane Noujaim
results.brief_description: In the late 1990s the dot com world of business boomed, due to an increase of use of the internet by companies and individuals, and a realisation by investors that vast amounts of money were to be made in untapped niche markets. Kaleil Isaza Tuzman and Tom Herman are two entrepreneurial types, men who grew up together, fuelling each other’s dreams of an enterprise that would make them millionaires. Their idea is for an internet site which will allow people to pay parking fines, speeding fines, rates, get planning maps on line - it will serve as a link between people and government. “Startup.com” is a documentary that traces the progress of their company, govworks.com. Both men are shown to have differing but complimentary skills that enable them to raise close to twenty million dollars (US) from investors. Kaliel as CEO, is shown to be a master of public relations and a man not afraid to make difficult decisions. “Startup.com” is frank and revealing, laying bare the emotional upheaval and personal toll that the difficulties of getting their business up and running has on the two main players. “Startup.com” is a fascinating display of how friendship and commerce make for an interesting and challenging mix.

results.title: Starting your own business. Parts. 1-3
results.creator_credit: Millbank Films, Lloyds Bank and Ron Tanner
results.brief_description: Designed to forewarn those considering self-employment that there is no easy recipe for success and relates the stories of three people who decided to be their own boss. Highlights basic business pointers and identifies the problems and pitfalls of going solo.

results.title: Starting to read: ducks
results.brief_description: Shows a variety of ducks on a farm to introduce such words and concepts as big, small, walk, feet, water and eat. Superimposes the words on the picture and uses a song to intorduce the words being studied. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels

results.title: Starting Tapestry (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Pat Marshall, Maggie Clarke and MSI Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Joy for Life”.
There is a wonderfully rich variety of tapestry styles throughout the world and the techniques are easy to learn at any age. “Starting tapestry” will show you the materials you need, how to work some basic stitches and some attractive items which are easy to make. Hannah Gordon introduces the many possibilities tapestry offers to everyone, young and old.
